hints.content: There are $\color{green}12\color{black}$ eggs total.
There are $\color{blue}3\color{black}$ equal groups of eggs.

We can think of division as the following:

$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ Number of Groups}\color{black}$

or

$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{maroon}\text{ Size of the Groups}}$
The expression $\color{green}12\color{black}\div\color{blue}3\color{black}$ will tell us how many eggs are in the basket.

question.content:
There are $12$ eggs divided evenly in $3$ baskets.

[[image 0]]

**Which expression will tell us how many eggs are in each basket?**

hints.content: There are $\color{green}10\color{black}$ cookies total.
There are $\color{maroon}2\color{black}$ cookies in each group.

We can think of division as the following:

$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{blue}\text{ Number of Groups}\color{black}$

or

$\color{green}\text{ Total}\color{black}\div\color{maroon}\text{ Size of the Groups}}$
The expression $\color{green}10\color{black}\div\color{maroon}2\color{black}$ will tell us how many equal groups of cookies there are.

question.content:
There are $10$ cookies divided evenly into groups of $2$ cookies.

[[image 0]]


**Which expression will tell us how many equal groups of cookies there are?**

question.content:
Paulo has $27$ apples divided evenly in $3$ bags.

**Which image could represent this situation?**

options: [Three groups of 3 apples. Each group of apples has a circle around it.]
[Three groups of 9 apples. Each group of apples has a circle around it.]
[Four groups of 9 apples. Each group of apples has a circle around it.]
correctAnswers: [Three groups of 9 apples. Each group of apples has a circle around it.]

hints.content:
There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ apples.  

We can look at $\color{green}\text{how many equal-sized groups of apples}\color{black}$  there are or $\color{maroon}\text{how many apples are in every group}}$.

### $\color{green}\text{Number of equal-sized groups}\color{black}$

There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ total apples divided into $\color{green}5$ equal groups.


[[image 0]]

[[image 1]]

[[image 2]]

[[image 3]]

[[image 4]]
$\color{blue}30\color{black}$ divided into $\color{green}5$ equal groups is $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{green}5$.

### $\color{maroon}\text{Number of apples in each group}\color{black}$


There are $\color{blue}30\color{black}$ apples total divided into groups of $\color{maroon}6$ apples.


[[image 0]]

[[image 1]]

[[image 2]]

[[image 3]]

[[image 4]]
$\color{blue}30\color{black}$ divided into groups of $\color{maroon}6$ is $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{maroon}6$.

The following expressions could represent the picture:

-  $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{green}5$ 
- $\color{blue}30\color{black}\div \color{maroon}6$
